page.title: 10OIL RIG WORKERS, PORTESSIE.
page.content:
MY DAD IS WILLIAM CORMACK. HE WORKS ON THE OIL RIGS. HIS JOB IS A HANDYMAN. HE FIXES BURST PIPES, BROKEN DOWN THINGS, CARPETS AND TILES. HE TRAVELS TO THE OIL RIG BY HELICOPTER FROM ABERDEEN TO SUMBURGH THEN BY CHINOOK TO THE OIL RIG WHICH IS ABOUT 281 MILES OUT IN THE NORTH SEA. IT TAKES HIM ABOUT 10 HOURS TO TRAVEL FROM HOME TO WORK. HE IS AWAY FOR A FORTNIGHT THEN HE COMES HOME FOR A FORTNIGHT. STEVEN COULL'S DAD, JOHN COULL, WORKS ON THE BEATRICE B FIELD. HIS JOB IS THAT OF A WAITER. HE SERVES MANY STEAKS WITH CHIPS. DURING HIS TIME OFF, HE PLAYS SNOOKER AND WATCHES VIDEOS. STEVEN'S DAD SAYS THAT THE FIELD HE IS ON IS THE BEST.
{BY RICHARD CORMACK AND STEVEN {COULL.
